bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, January 15, 1941

div1.p: Hutchison sends Hench autographed pictures of Kissinger and Moran. He also discusses his latest family trip.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, January 15, 1941

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
January 15, 1941

div1.p:
Enclosed are pictures from Kissinger
and Moran autographed for yourself. I hope these
will replace the lost ones satisfactorily. About
the time you get them replaced the others will
turn up somewhere. That's the way it always is.

We just got back last evening from
California. We flew most of both ways. We were
grounded a couple of times coming back but even
so we made it twelve hours sooner than we could
have done by train. We had a very pleasant trip
but I am sorry that we could not include Rochester
in our schedule. Now I shall be looking for a
chance to come up there on some other connection.

We are very much enjoying the London
paper. It is most interesting these days and thank
you again for sending it to us.
Give our love to Mary and the children.
div1.closer:
Affectionately yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
RCH/M
